topic.title: SDK Authentication
topic.shortdesc: Role-Based Access Control, requires that in order to access a cluster-resource, a user pass credentials to Couchbase Server; and in consequence, be successfully authenticated and authorized. The SDK now provides enhanced support for the passing of credentials.

section.title: Using Authentication
section.p: To access cluster-resources, a program must authenticate, as a user, with the cluster itself. Once the user is identified, they are authorized to access certain resources in certain ways, based on the roles associated with their identity.

The passing of credentials differs slightly, depending on the language that is being used. Code examples for Node.js, Java, Python, PHP, Go, C, and .NET are provided in the section Getting Started with the SDK.

section.title: Understanding Users, Roles, and Privileges
section.p: All aspects of the Couchbase RBAC system are covered in the section Authorization. Specifically, for information on:

ul.li: Adding Users and assigning roles, by means of the Couchbase Web Console, see Creating and Managing Users with the UI.
Roles required for resource-access, and the privileges they entail, see RBAC for Applications.
Resources controlled by Couchbase RBAC, see Resources Under Access Control.
